Class Features

  • java.lang.Object
    • Features

  • public class Features
extends java.lang.Object
    Features class is responsible for whole program logic, it calculates data, draws charts, parse JSON from urls/file, save JSON to files. It has 3 inner classes- each is structure to contain more than one class parsed from JSON in pair or in set.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Features.ValueSensorsPair
      This class represents pair of Sensor and Value, it is used in lowestValue function

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Features()
      This public constructor creates new HashMap to store stations and fill this map with other function- called prepareStations() .

    • Constructor Detail

      • Features

        public Features()
         throws java.io.IOException
        This public constructor creates new HashMap to store stations and fill this map with other function- called prepareStations() .
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when findAll.json cannot be found in local files.

    • Method Detail

      • findStationByName

        public MeasureStation findStationByName(java.lang.String name)
        Method just search for station in stations HashMap set
        Parameters:
        name - name of the station we are looking for
        Returns:
        MeasureStation object representing one measure station

      • getAirIndex

        public AirIndex getAirIndex(MeasureStation station)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Method get Air Index of station - it may be Very good, good etc. It use GSON API to parse AirIndex object from [id]ind.JSON file or from REST API
        Parameters:
        station - MeasureStation object representing station for which we want to get index
        Returns:
        AirIndex object represeting air index measured and calculated for station from parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when there is no file representing index and REST API doesn't give us JSON representation baased on stationID

      • getMeasureData

        public MeasureData getMeasureData(long sensorId)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method creates MeasureData object representing recent measures made by station's sensor we want.
        Parameters:
        sensorId - - ID of sensor whose measures are represented by MeasureData object.
        Returns:
        MeasureData object with list of measures, their values made every hour sorted by date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when there is no file representing measures and REST API doesn't give us JSON representation baased on sensor's ID

      • getValuebyDateAndStation

        public MeasureValues getValuebyDateAndStation(java.lang.String param,
                                              java.lang.String date,
                                              long stationId)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns single parameter's measure value based on date and station's ID
        Parameters:
        param - Param object representing measured param, for instance CO- Carbon monoxide
        date - String representing date (yyyy-MM-dd HH:MM:SS) when measure took place
        stationId - ID of station from which we want measure
        Returns:
        MeasureValues representing single value and date when it was measured of one single parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when files cannot be found or REST API cannot give us proper JSON representation. Exception also may be thrown when date is not listed in JSON file representing measures or when paramter is not measured on checked station.

      • getSensors

        public Sensor[] getSensors(long stationId)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns array of every sensor connected with station
        Parameters:
        stationId - ID of station from which we want get sensors
        Returns:
        array of Sensor representing list of station's sensors, single sensor measures only one parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when file cannot be found, REST API cannot give us JSON file.

      • getSensor

        public Sensor getSensor(long stationId,
                        java.lang.String param)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns single sensor of specified parameter and station
        Parameters:
        stationId - ID of station from which we want to get sensor's information
        param - Param object representing parameter which we want to check
        Returns:
        Sensor object representing single sensor
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when file cannot be found, REST API cannot give us JSON file or when station we wanted to check lacks in sensors measuring given parameter.

      • getAverage

        public java.lang.Double getAverage(java.lang.String param,
                                   long stationID,
                                   java.util.Date dateFrom,
                                   java.util.Date dateTo)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns average amount of measured parameter in given time period.
        Parameters:
        param - Param object represting checked parameter
        stationID - ID of station we want to check average value
        dateFrom - Date object representing date from which we want to count average value
        dateTo - Date object representing date upto which we want to count average value
        Returns:
        average value of measured parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when file cannot be found REST API doesn't give proper JSON file or when there were no measures in given period of time, or when this station doesn't have sensor for given parameter.

      • greatestDeltas

        public Param greatestDeltas(java.util.ArrayList<MeasureStation> stations,
                            java.lang.String date)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        returns parameter which fluctuated most from given date until now
        Parameters:
        stations - list of stations we want to check for fluctuations
        date - date after which fluctuations will be calculated
        Returns:
        Param object representing parameter we were looking for
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when there is no proper file, REST API doesn't provide JSON file or when there were no measures on some stations/sensors.

      • sumDeltas

        public double sumDeltas(MeasureData data,
                        java.lang.String date)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • lowestValue

        public Features.ValueSensorsPair lowestValue(java.lang.String date)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method search in every station for lowest measured parameter and it's value in specified date. Measured value must be higher than 0
        Parameters:
        date - represents a date we want to check
        Returns:
        Features.ValueSensorsPair object representing pair of value and sensor which measured this value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when files cannot be found, REST API doesn;t provide JSON files or when date canont be found in any measures list

      • findNMostPolluted

        public java.util.ArrayList<Features.ValueSensorPair> findNMostPolluted(MeasureStation station,
                                                                       java.lang.String date)
                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns set of Sensor and value pairs. Values must exceed their pollution standard to be included in this set on given date. When there are no exceeds the list is empty. We use class ValueSensorPair. This method uses different class than Features.ValueSensorsPair because we want to sort this list by exceeds. So this method is able to compare objects by value's exceeds.
        Parameters:
        station - MeasureStation object representing station we are checking
        date - representing date we want to check for pollution's exceeds
        Returns:
        list of values-sensor pairs which exceeded pollution standards
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when files cannot be found, REST API doesn't provide JSON files

      • getParamExtremes

        public Features.StationValueExtremes getParamExtremes(Param param)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method finds two values and station where they were measured. One value is maximum and second is minimum of given parameter.
        Parameters:
        param - Param object represenitng parameter we want to check
        Returns:
        StationValueExtremes object which represent two vaalues and corresponding stationns
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when there is no file, REST API doesn't give correct JSON file

      • dataForDrawingChart

        public java.util.ArrayList<Features.stationMeasures> dataForDrawingChart(Param param,
                                                                         java.lang.String dateFrom,
                                                                         java.lang.String dateTo,
                                                                         MeasureStation[] stations)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns list of objects containing infromation about stations and measures who were made there. Measures must meet few conditions specified in params.
        Parameters:
        param - represents param measuures we are looking for
        dateFrom - represents beginning of time period we are checking
        dateTo - represents end of time period we are checking
        stations - represents stations we want to check
        Returns:
        ArrayList of stationMeasures objects representing station and measures
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when there is no file, REST API doesn't provide correct JSON file, or when there are no measures in given time period in any station

      • drawChart

        public void drawChart(java.util.ArrayList<Features.stationMeasures> list)
        This method draws a chart based on stationMeasures list, usually provided by dataForDrawingChart method
        Parameters:
        list - list of Stations and measures to draw
